name: Nick Clifford
tagline: Metis, run by the fine instructors at thoughtbot, inc.
body:
##I'm Nick, a full-stack Ruby on Rails developer with experience in JavaScript, CSS, Git, PostgreSQL and associated languages.  

####Here's a project sampler, just click the links to check out some code  

* [DiveSights](https://github.com/ncliffor/capstone-project) - Locate and share local dive sites. Utilizing the GoogleMaps API to add new sites, the [`geocoder`](https://github.com/ncliffor/capstone-project/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/geocoder-simple.js) populates the form with relevant information for ease of use by users.
* [Biddr](https://github.com/ncliffor/biddr) - Too much stuff? Not enough stuff? Time to visit the auctions. I loved working on the [`sortable table`](https://github.com/ncliffor/biddr/blob/master/app/helpers/table_sort_helper.rb) which protects from SQL injection through the helper and [`categories_controller`](https://github.com/ncliffor/biddr/blob/master/app/controllers/categories_controller.rb#L30)
* [Taskr](https://github.com/ncliffor/taskr) - Keep track of all your To Do lists. AJAX was implemented to [`complete`](https://github.com/ncliffor/taskr/blob/56d5303aa676434b68896d189d1f2e78c1901a71/app/assets/javascripts/complete-task.js) and [`delete`](https://github.com/ncliffor/taskr/blob/56d5303aa676434b68896d189d1f2e78c1901a71/app/assets/javascripts/delete-task.js) tasks and enhance user experience.
* [Shoutr](https://github.com/ncliffor/shoutr) - A social media service for yelling all your thoughts. Routes were altered to display a user's [`username`](https://github.com/ncliffor/shoutr/blob/e519d164a16b765fae95812aa1e8d0098517d642/config/routes.rb) in the URL in place of ids.
* [Pixtr](https://github.com/ncliffor/pixtr) - An app for sharing your images. Join tables and various associations were exercised to set up groups, memberships, likes, comments and category tags.
* [Craigstr](https://github.com/NateJBeck/craigstr) - A place for all your general posts. This app was created as an exercise in pair programming and git rebasing.
